results.title: Oh, Serafina!
results.brief_description: Augusto’s best friends are the birds that he talks to in the park while seeking refuge from his crazy and constantly arguing parents. After his father kills himself by jumping off the local bell-tower, Augusto reluctantly takes over the management of his family’s Mother-of-Pearl button factory, which in accordance with his own ecological beliefs, he refuses to industrialize. In his new workplace he is seduced by the ambitious Palmira, who he eventually marries, and who has him committed to a lunatic asylum where he meets the woman of his dreams, the ecologically-minded Serafina. In Italian language with no English subtitles.

results.title: On a moonlit night
results.creator_credit: Lina Wertmüller, Fulvio Lucisano, Raidue, Carthago Films, Istituto Luce and Italian International Film
results.brief_description: John Knot is a man of the world and a lover of freedom and adventure. After years of reporting on wars, he devotes himself to reporting on the “plague of the century”, AIDS. Years ago while working together in Lebanon, John and Massimo, a young Italian photographer, met a woman photographer, Joelle. She and John had an affair and then suddenly one day she disappeared. Whilst travelling the world with Masimo, pretending to be HIV positive in order to record reactions from different people, he meets Joelle again in a Paris newspaper office. They make a vow never to separate again, but fate has other plans for them. Starring Rutger Hauer, Natassja Kinski, Faye Dunaway, Peter O’Toole and Lorraine Bracco. Costumes designed by Gianni Versace.

results.title: Horror Hotel
results.brief_description: Screenwriter George Baxt combines the “Psycho” gimmick of killing the apparent heroine at the beginning of the film with elements of the Salem witches story thrown in for added spine tingling suspense. Professor Driscoll (Christopher Lee) sends Nan (Venetia Stevenson), one of his students, to Whitewood, Massachusetts to research local legends of witchcraft. In the decaying village she is used as a human sacrifice by the witches coven. Nan’s boyfriend and brother go to look for her, and discover an entire village full of zombie-like creatures dressed in monastic habits. The finale is so full of intrigue that you must see this ghoulish epic for yourself.

results.title: Four weddings and a funeral (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Duncan Kenworthy, Working Title Films, Channel Four and PolyGram
results.brief_description: This charming and quirky British romantic comedy stars Hugh Grant and Andy Macdowell as the two lovers who belong together…perhaps! An excellent cast, including an hilarious cameo by Rowan Atkinson as the tongued-tied vicar, “Four weddings & a funeral” is unashamedly sentimental, but at the same time reveals not only the “funny side” of relationships, but their fragility. As Hugh Grant catapaults from one emotional and social disaster to another, due to an excess of good manners and a very British tendency towards “keeping a stiff upper lip”, he eventually discovers that the course of true love diverges from his expected course down the altar.

results.title: Herbie rides again
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Another adventure with the VW with a mind of its own; Herbie. In this escapade Herbie comes to the assistance of a little old lady. They combine their efforts to stop a tycoon from building the world’s highest building on her property. Starring Helen Hayes, Ken Berry, Stefanie Powers, John McIntire and Keenan Wynn. Based on a story by Gordon Buford, screenplay by Bill Walsh.

results.title: Dune
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Raffaella De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Based on Frank Herbert’s cult science fiction novel, “Dune” follows the fortune of Paul Atreides (Kyle Machlachan), whose family is persecuted by the Emperor (Jose Ferrer) and the evil Baron Harkonnen (Kenneth McMillan). Paul and his mother (Francesca Annis) seek refuge in the deserts of the planet Arakis. They join the Fremen who live under the desert sands. Soon the prophecy of a messiah becomes true as Paul leads the Fremen in battle against the forces controlling and manipulating their planet and the precious spice Melange. David Lynch manages to create a sense of the complex dynastical world which Frank Herbert had created in his popular novel, whilst retaining Lynch’s love for the bizarre and disturbing. A large international cast provides substance to this film, including Linda Hunt, Sian Phillips, Dean Stockwell, Jurgen Prochnow, Patrick Stewart, Sting and Freddie Jones.

results.title: The Love bug
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Herbie is one of Disney’s most popular live action characters. Affectionately nicknamed ‘The Love Bug’, Herbie teams up with an unsuccessful race-car driver, Jim Douglas. Jim is amazed to find his driving improves in his new car, but realises the success is due to the car with a mind of its own when someone tries to steal Herbie. Starring Dean Jones, David Tomlinson, Michele Lee and Buddy Hackett.

results.title: Throw Momma from the train
results.creator_credit: Danny DeVito, Larry Brezner and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Larry Donner (Billy Crystal) is not happy. His ex-wife has stolen his novel, reaping the financial rewards and giving Larry a serious case of writer’s block. To complicate matters Owen (Danny De Vito), a student in Larry’s creative writing class wants to participate in a murder-swap; Larry’s wife for Owen’s mother. This eventuates after Larry recommends Owen sees Hitchcock’s ‘Strangers on a train’ to assist in his writing. Owen misinterprets his intentions, taking the film literally. It seems like a simple task but killing Momma isn’t that easy! Written by Stu Silver.

results.title: Gettysburg
results.creator_credit: Ronald F Maxwell, Moctesuma Esparza, Robert Katz and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: The American Civil War raged for nearly four years and cost over 642,000 men their lives. In a single battle, during three days of brutal combat in the town of gettysburg, nearly 50,000 soldiers were killed - more than during all the years of the Vietnam War. Though it recounts one of the bloodiest chapters in history, this film is about more than just statistics - it is the story of ordinary men caught in an extraordinary battle to fight for their beliefs and freedom. An all star cast headed by Martin Sheen, Tom Berenger, Jeff Daniels and Sam Elliot bring these remarkable characters to life in a thrilling epic that captures powerful emotions and showcases some of the most awesome action sequences ever filmed!

results.title: The Talk of the town
results.brief_description: This zany romantic comedy, nominated for six Academy Awards stars Cary Grant as Leopold Dilg, a prison escapee who hides out in the home of schoolteacher Nora, played by Jean Arthur. Leopold enlists the help of Nora to try and convince her summer tenant, Supreme Court candidate Michael Lightcap (Ronald Colman), that Dilig was falsely imprisoned on the charge of arson. As the charming and persuasive fugitive and conservative lawyer share living arrangements they also find themselves sharing a growing affection for the beautiful schoolteacher.
